## Viewport.updateElement() method

Updates the element with the given id. Any of the provided values may be null, in which case they are ignored (we never overwrite an existing value with null).

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
updateElement(id: string, x: number, y: number, width: number, height: number, rotation: number, doNotRecalculateBounds?: boolean): ViewportElement<T["E"]>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  id | string |  |
|  x | number |  |
|  y | number |  |
|  width | number |  |
|  height | number |  |
|  rotation | number |  |
|  doNotRecalculateBounds | boolean | Defaults to false. For internal use. If true, does not update viewport bounds after updating the element. |

<b>Returns:</b>

[ViewportElement](./core.viewportelement)<!-- -->&lt;T\["E"\]&gt;
